line.comment: * Task 202.
* For performance purposes, we avoid starting every cycle at the exact same time.
* Zero Hour 1.6
* Mordan2
* Performance purposes.
* Mordan2
* just for debugging
* Reset all the Jump station perks. For debugging purposes.
* Fixed a rare bug where the sector could be Unknown.
* Mordan2
* hotfix. strip color, or it will append the color over and over to the station name.
* If station was renamed, and had been colored at some point, you will lose your color. This will auto-restore it.
* display subtitle text: text='Restored Station name Color' duration=3000 ms
* Since the player can re-homebase one of these fighters in order to gain control of it, we have to use something other than their homebase to track which system they should be defending.
* So basically, we iterate through all player owned fighters looking for whichever ones are 'tagged' with this station. That is the system they must defend.
* If ship has this outpost as it's tag
* The player has moved this ship or done something to cause it to relocate. destroy it.

line.text: ' militia fighter exploded. Apparently it wandered off course.'

line.comment: * Mordan2
* The player has either tried to subvert their orders, OR they sent the ship in for Maintenance or Repair. In those cases, we need to re-apply the defend sector task
* once the task is free.
* The fighter must have sustained some damage, lets try to get it in for repair.
* Mordan3. Added START. This must be asynchronous or the station task gets delayed.
* Init station fighter count. Each station has a value of 2-4 support fighters, with the upper number in the 9973 config file. Only relevant when the perk is active.
* Now determine when the last fighter was created so we can stagger them. Also, the highter population of a system, the more rapidly they are created/replaced.
* if not enough time has elaped, just stop here.
* For 100 people in the station, it will require 20 minutes to acquire a new ship. The more people, the less time it will take.
* Create a new system support fighter
* $newship-> set homebase to [THIS]
* $msg = 'Station Fighter created at ' + $playtime
* START [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.StackNews' : text=$msg addToHistory=[TRUE] breakingNews=[FALSE]
* $newship-> send audio message 77 to player
* end if perk enabled.
* end Mordan
* Define the time when the event will trigger, and the type of the event.
* Would be unfair to pick another event instead of this one, so we just postpone.
* Start the event if it's planned.

line.text: ' has started at your Outpost in '

line.comment: * Manage current event.
* This is the only event that is managed here.
* End of the event.
* Check if we can produce anything.
* Get variables.
* ZH 2.0 - all player Outposts can generate tax without the perk
* skip if [THIS]-> call script 'Mayhem.IsPerkUnlocked' : perk='Tax'
* endsub
* generate a free Hackerchip
* select a sector, scan ports of all ships inside, install possible backdoors
* ZH 2.0 - now working for all ship types
* skip if $ship-> is of class [Huge Ship]
* continue
* do if $system == 1 OR $system == 5
* no automatic stealing money or bailing ships
* continue
* skip if [THIS]-> call script 'Mayhem.IsPerkUnlocked' : perk='Space Weed manufacture'
* endsub
* Phanon Outposts never produce food
* ZH 2.0 - no more food production after player joins OCV
* Phanon Outposts never consume food
* ZH 2.0 - no more food consumption after player joins OCV
* The AI consumes food, but does not risk starvation.
* Growth.
* growth is now limited directly in Mayhem.GetNaturalGrowth to never overshoot max pop, because arriving Refugees can exceed max pop.
* do if $people > $maxPeople
* $people = $maxPeople
* Not every people die at once!
* START [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.Infobox' : text=$t icon=null timeout=null fadeout=null
* Loop.
* Invalid missiles (3.8).
* Zero Hour 1.8
* ZH 2.0 - garbage quality didnt work
* Reserve management. Note that AI recycles all equipment before putting the ship in reserve (Mayhem.Task.SellYourselfFrom).
* Also note that the AI will still have to pay time to build ships from reserve (should have no impact on gameplay).
* ZH 2.0 - terraforming limits local player outpost + all phanon outposts to crafting at snails pace
* Add object(s).
* Ship.
* Ship or station.
* Zero Hour 1.10
* See Mayhem.Squadron.GetBuildingOutposts.
* Laser, missile, shield and station.
* Increase specialization level.
* every hour = 3600 seconds
* For each neighbor,
* If owned by another major race and not at war with them
* improve relations a bit, up to 0. (neutral)
* if improving to neutral, give a message.
* what is the penalty for putting down an outpost next to someone? that amount should be repaired over the course of a day.
* skip this outpost
* skip any outposts we own ourselves.

* Only perk races in this array. Ensures we only perk 1 time for a neighboring race even if there are multiple outposts present for that race. see below where we remove element to avoid processing a race twice.
* remove this race from the commonwealth array so we don't perk this race again in this loop.
* You can't improve rep with faction past Neutral using this perk.
* are we at war?
* are we at permanent war with this race. If so, the perk won't help. Probably irrelevant call, but we'll make it anyway.
* Set/check a global here, indicating the last reputation with this faction. If it has lowered, it means the player is continuing to harass the faction.
* if Réputation actuelle has gone down, they have been bad.
* Amount to repair every 24 hours Mordan3 adjust.
* save rep to lastReputation global here, which is race specific

display subtitle text: text='Restored Station name Color' duration=3000 ms
Since the player can re-homebase one of these fighters in order to gain control of it, we have to use something other than their homebase to track which system they should be defending.
So basically, we iterate through all player owned fighters looking for whichever ones are 'tagged' with this station. That is the system they must defend.
If ship has this outpost as it's tag

The player has either tried to subvert their orders, OR they sent the ship in for Maintenance or Repair. In those cases, we need to re-apply the defend sector task
The fighter must have sustained some damage, lets try to get it in for repair.
Mordan3. Added START. This must be asynchronous or the station task gets delayed.
Init station fighter count. Each station has a value of 2-4 support fighters, with the upper number in the 9973 config file. Only relevant when the perk is active.
Now determine when the last fighter was created so we can stagger them. Also, the highter population of a system, the more rapidly they are created/replaced.
if not enough time has elaped, just stop here.
For 100 people in the station, it will require 20 minutes to acquire a new ship. The more people, the less time it will take.
Create a new system support fighter

skip if $ship-> is of class [Huge Ship]

The AI consumes food, but does not risk starvation.
growth is now limited directly in Mayhem.GetNaturalGrowth to never overshoot max pop, because arriving Refugees can exceed max pop.
Not every people die at once!

Reserve management. Note that AI recycles all equipment before putting the ship in reserve (Mayhem.Task.SellYourselfFrom).
Also note that the AI will still have to pay time to build ships from reserve (should have no impact on gameplay).

if improving to neutral, give a message.

Only perk races in this array. Ensures we only perk 1 time for a neighboring race even if there are multiple outposts present for that race. see below where we remove element to avoid processing a race twice.
remove this race from the commonwealth array so we don't perk this race again in this loop.
You can't improve rep with faction past Neutral using this perk.
are we at permanent war with this race. If so, the perk won't help. Probably irrelevant call, but we'll make it anyway.

if Réputation actuelle has gone down, they have been bad.
